001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.DriverStationJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.BooleanEvent;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
010import java.util.HashMap;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013/**
014 * Handle input from standard HID devices connected to the Driver Station.
015 *
016 * <p>This class handles standard input that comes from the Driver Station. Each time a value is
017 * requested the most recent value is returned. There is a single class instance for each device and
018 * the mapping of ports to hardware buttons depends on the code in the Driver Station.
019 */
020public class GenericHID {
021  /** Represents a rumble output on the JoyStick. */
022  public enum RumbleType {
023    kLeftRumble,
024    kRightRumble
025  }
026
027  public enum HIDType {
028    kUnknown(-1),
029    kXInputUnknown(0),
030    kXInputGamepad(1),
031    kXInputWheel(2),
032    kXInputArcadeStick(3),
033    kXInputFlightStick(4),
034    kXInputDancePad(5),
035    kXInputGuitar(6),
036    kXInputGuitar2(7),
037    kXInputDrumKit(8),
038    kXInputGuitar3(11),
039    kXInputArcadePad(19),
040    kHIDJoystick(20),
041    kHIDGamepad(21),
042    kHIDDriving(22),
043    kHIDFlight(23),
044    kHID1stPerson(24);
045
046    public final int value;
047
048    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
049    private static final Map<Integer, HIDType> map = new HashMap<>();
050
051    HIDType(int value) {
052      this.value = value;
053    }
054
055    static {
056      for (HIDType hidType : HIDType.values()) {
057        map.put(hidType.value, hidType);
058      }
059    }
060
061    public static HIDType of(int value) {
062      return map.get(value);
063    }
064  }
065
066  private final int m_port;
067  private int m_outputs;
068  private short m_leftRumble;
069  private short m_rightRumble;
070
071  /**
072   * Construct an instance of a device.
073   *
074   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
075   */
076  public GenericHID(int port) {
077    m_port = port;
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Get the button value (starting at button 1).
082   *
083   * <p>The buttons are returned in a single 16 bit value with one bit representing the state of
084   * each button. The appropriate button is returned as a boolean value.
085   *
086   * <p>This method returns true if the button is being held down at the time that this method is
087   * being called.
088   *
089   * @param button The button number to be read (starting at 1)
090   * @return The state of the button.
091   */
092  public boolean getRawButton(int button) {
093    return DriverStation.getStickButton(m_port, (byte) button);
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Whether the button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
098   *
099   * <p>This method returns true if the button went from not pressed to held down since the last
100   * time this method was called. This is useful if you only want to call a function once when you
101   * press the button.
102   *
103   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
104   * @return Whether the button was pressed since the last check.
105   */
106  public boolean getRawButtonPressed(int button) {
107    return DriverStation.getStickButtonPressed(m_port, (byte) button);
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Whether the button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
112   *
113   * <p>This method returns true if the button went from held down to not pressed since the last
114   * time this method was called. This is useful if you only want to call a function once when you
115   * release the button.
116   *
117   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
118   * @return Whether the button was released since the last check.
119   */
120  public boolean getRawButtonReleased(int button) {
121    return DriverStation.getStickButtonReleased(m_port, button);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
126   *
127   * @param button the button index
128   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
129   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the given loop.
130   */
131  public BooleanEvent button(int button, EventLoop loop) {
132    return new BooleanEvent(loop, () -> getRawButton(button));
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Get the value of the axis.
137   *
138   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0.
139   * @return The value of the axis.
140   */
141  public double getRawAxis(int axis) {
142    return DriverStation.getStickAxis(m_port, axis);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Get the angle in degrees of a POV on the HID.
147   *
148   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
149   * upper-left is 315).
150   *
151   * @param pov The index of the POV to read (starting at 0). Defaults to 0.
152   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
153   */
154  public int getPOV(int pov) {
155    return DriverStation.getStickPOV(m_port, pov);
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Get the angle in degrees of the default POV (index 0) on the HID.
160   *
161   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
162   * upper-left is 315).
163   *
164   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
165   */
166  public int getPOV() {
167    return getPOV(0);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Get the number of axes for the HID.
172   *
173   * @return the number of axis for the current HID
174   */
175  public int getAxisCount() {
176    return DriverStation.getStickAxisCount(m_port);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * For the current HID, return the number of POVs.
181   *
182   * @return the number of POVs for the current HID
183   */
184  public int getPOVCount() {
185    return DriverStation.getStickPOVCount(m_port);
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * For the current HID, return the number of buttons.
190   *
191   * @return the number of buttons for the current HID
192   */
193  public int getButtonCount() {
194    return DriverStation.getStickButtonCount(m_port);
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Get if the HID is connected.
199   *
200   * @return true if the HID is connected
201   */
202  public boolean isConnected() {
203    return DriverStation.isJoystickConnected(m_port);
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Get the type of the HID.
208   *
209   * @return the type of the HID.
210   */
211  public HIDType getType() {
212    return HIDType.of(DriverStation.getJoystickType(m_port));
213  }
214
215  /**
216   * Get the name of the HID.
217   *
218   * @return the name of the HID.
219   */
220  public String getName() {
221    return DriverStation.getJoystickName(m_port);
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Get the axis type of a joystick axis.
226   *
227   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0.
228   * @return the axis type of a joystick axis.
229   */
230  public int getAxisType(int axis) {
231    return DriverStation.getJoystickAxisType(m_port, axis);
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Get the port number of the HID.
236   *
237   * @return The port number of the HID.
238   */
239  public int getPort() {
240    return m_port;
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Set a single HID output value for the HID.
245   *
246   * @param outputNumber The index of the output to set (1-32)
247   * @param value The value to set the output to
248   */
249  public void setOutput(int outputNumber, boolean value) {
250    m_outputs = (m_outputs & ~(1 << (outputNumber - 1))) | ((value ? 1 : 0) << (outputNumber - 1));
251    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
252  }
253
254  /**
255   * Set all HID output values for the HID.
256   *
257   * @param value The 32 bit output value (1 bit for each output)
258   */
259  public void setOutputs(int value) {
260    m_outputs = value;
261    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * Set the rumble output for the HID. The DS currently supports 2 rumble values, left rumble and
266   * right rumble.
267   *
268   * @param type Which rumble value to set
269   * @param value The normalized value (0 to 1) to set the rumble to
270   */
271  public void setRumble(RumbleType type, double value) {
272    if (value < 0) {
273      value = 0;
274    } else if (value > 1) {
275      value = 1;
276    }
277    if (type == RumbleType.kLeftRumble) {
278      m_leftRumble = (short) (value * 65535);
279    } else {
280      m_rightRumble = (short) (value * 65535);
281    }
282    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
283  }
284}
